item.title: Summary: The Lean Startup by Eric Ries - Introduction
item.description: Summary Writer talks about his own failure building a startup A lesson from both of his successes and failure: its the boring stuff that matters the most - startup success can be engineered by following the right process - can be learned and can be taught Entrepreneurship is a kind of management A new entrepreneur movement built on many previous management and product development idea including: lean manufacturing, design thinking, customer development and agile development Origins of the lean startup Business and marketing functions of a startup are essential as engineering and product development aspect of a startup - deserves an equally rigorous methodology to guide them Author mission: to improve the success rate of new innovative products, worldwide The Lean Startup Method Principles of the lean startup Entrepreneurs are everywhere

item.title: About
item.description: “The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do” I have one goal in the year 2023. I told myself to read more books. But this time I want to make sure that I understand and remember things that I have read. Here I will share summary and highlights of books that I have read, in order for me to revise them whenever I need some inspiration.
